snippet: Health law says that the parents of Thaiya Spruill-Smith have an equal say in what happens to her organs, and because they disagree, donation will not occur.
abstract: Terrell Smith, father of 2-year-old Thaiya Spruill-Smith, victim of assault to which her stepfather David Adams confessed, prevails in case over fate of his daughter's organs, keeping her body intact; Spruill-Smith was declared brain-dead but was kept on life support as Smith and her mother Teoka Spruill argued over whether her organs should be donated.

byline.contributor: Anemona Hartocollis and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Health law says that the parents of Thaiya Spruill-Smith have an equal say in what happens to her organs, and because they disagree, donation will not occur.

headline.main: Father Prevails, Halting the Donation of His Brain-Dead Daughter’s Organs
headline.print_headline: Father Prevails, Halting the Donation of His Brain-Dead Daughter’s Organs
